subject: Re: [junit] Asserting Equality Of Collection Elements
msgSnippet: You might try using an ExpectationList from the mockobjects library. www.mockobjects.com (the CVS repository is substantially more up to date). S. ... From:
messageBody:
You might try using an ExpectationList from the mockobjects library.
www.mockobjects.com (the CVS repository is substantially more up to
date).

S.

----- Original Message -----
From: "kms_junit" <kms_junit@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, May 27, 2002 1:06 AM
Subject: [junit] Asserting Equality Of Collection Elements


> I'm new to JUnit, and have been trying to find a way to determine if
> the items in 2 collections are the same. I created a collection (
> collection "A") that contains my expected results. My test case
> creates a collection (collection "B"). Now I need to ensure that the
> items in "A" are the same items that are in "B". I can create my own
> method that takes both collections as parameters and returns a
> boolean if the items are the same ( by looping through the
> collections) but was wondering if there was a way to use an assert*
> method to do the same thing.
